posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.64 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ More split screen UI fixes
★ Even more backup fixes
★ Bumping the min SDK requirement to 23 (should not have any visible changes for most)

Complete list of new commits since 7.63.3:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.63.3…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.63 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.64.0 (161200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

51 new commits since 7.63.3:

Show commits

  • Preserve pane expansion state across window size class changes. [1]

  • Ignore unreadable wallpapers. [2]

  • Show exact alarm megaphone if Signal Backups enabled. [3]

  • Fix backup row disabled state in settings. [4]

  • Add some resiliance to custom chat color export. [5]

  • Add protections around exporting unknown recipients in dlists. [6]

  • Add validations to ensure some simple chat updates are exported properly. [7]

  • Remove unnecessary status code handling. [8]

  • Validate usernames during backup export. [9]

  • Add additional group update validations during export. [10]

  • Add extra validation to call link exports. [11]

  • Add addition validations to chat wallpapers on export. [12]

  • Increment minimum SDK version to 23. [13]

  • Add additional validations around incoming message on export. [14]

  • Update diffuse gradle wrapper validation to v5. [15]

  • Fix some edit messages causing unread threads after restore. [16]

  • Clear out checks for SDK < 23 as they're no longer relevant. [17]

  • Update to latest backup tests. [18]

  • Convert NotificationProfilesSettingsFragment to compose. [19]

  • Fix the UI being unresponsive during media restore. [20]

  • Fix read group message rendering as pending after import. [21]

  • Convert expire timer settings fragment to compose. [22]

  • Prevent possible backup bug when we fix group recipients. [23]

  • Prevent SVRB falling out of sync after re-registrations. [24]

  • On import, if any recipient is pending, mark overall message as pending. [25]

  • Fix enter key send with attachments. [26]

  • Fix incorrect mention notification setting sync. [27]

  • Consolidate back callback to a single delegate. [28]

  • Add null handling for backup subscriptions. [29]

  • Keep successful redemption message longer. [30]

  • Use a cancelation result instead of an exception for message sends. [31]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.59.3 [32]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.85.6 [33]

  • Add backup upgrade availability checks. [34]

  • Require key rotation to disable pins. [35]

  • Calling UI camera toggle in PIP and in pre-join state. [36]

  • Remove unused/broken ContactFilterView setText method. [37]

  • Add BackHandler compatibility layer. [38]

  • Update previews for CallScreen. [39]

  • Add back protection dialog on recovery key screen. [40]

  • Add confirmation check before ending a poll. [41]

  • Handle rate limits when rotating recovery key. [42]

  • Update to latest backup tests. [43]

  • Convert LogSectionSystemInfo to kotlin. [44]

  • Add last registration time to log. [45]

  • Fix validation check around thread merge events. [46]

  • Make ending a poll a blocking job. [47]

  • Fix reaction and state bar placement on new call screen. [48]

  • Fix navigation bar and display cutout overlap on compact-width screens in landscape. [49]

  • Update translations and other static files. [50]

  • Bump version to 7.64.0 [51]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.63.3…v7.64.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.cooked:
mtang-signal:

Bumping the min SDK requirement to 23 (should not have any visible changes for most)

SDK 23 is Android 6: https://developer.android.com/tools/releases/platforms#6.0

Just to update because I noticed a commit related to thread merges and backups: I’m still unable to make cloud backups on 7.64.0, and local backups are still fine

The error logs have not changed from my previous post: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.62 release - #32 by dishes8

Still giving: W BackupMessagesJob The backup file fails validation! Message: chat frame ChatId(9) error: chat item 1712270162185: thread merge not from ACI, Details: [MessageDetails(messageId=193823, dateSent=1712270162185, threadId=9, threadRecipientId=22, type=16, fromRecipientId=22, toRecipientId=22, hasBody=true, hasExtras=false, outgoing=false, viewOnce=false, isStory=false, isStoryReaction=false, originalMessageId=0, isLatestRevision=true)]

Logs after all frames were exported (looks the same as before)

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: i can no longer get the menu to appear in the chat list in the way i did before so seems like that was fixed

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked: I can recreate this. It happens when you put the app in an RTL locale / layout.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.64.2/cac00adcac1d307537a769c2cf198a063772909d391b1e116a5e7eaabb1d35d1

A new bug this beta. The status of removed users is still resulting in issues. A removed users is showing up as a person I can forward messages to. This probably shouldn’t be the case.

I also would like to propose the setting be appropriately named as hidden contact, since only a flag is being set and a profile key rotation (last I checked). This change would properly manage expectations. When a privacy minded individual sees removed, the expectation is that the contact details are entirely removed from the database, not a hidden flag set to true.

A tombstone in the chat is perfectly ok, but should probably be stored elsewhere with the ACI and profile data of the user. This would prevent privacy issues that have been showing up due to this handling:

  • Signal sending stories to people I’ve “removed”
  • Message requests not showing up for me to accept people, causing confusion around whether I’ve actually “removed” them or not.

Changing the name to hidden contacts would at least accurately represents that you’re not removing them from your device, just hiding them. I feel this should probably be more transparent, since the expectation behind remove is, y’know, removing the contact?

Kind of frustrated since I’ve already had to deal with this problem on multiple occasions, going back and forth between my contacts page to see if the contact is actually removed or not, surprised when data is actively being leaked to people I don’t have in my contacts.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
signal-2025-11-08-10-34-11-2261024×2125 176 KB

No button to flip camera while a 1:1 video call is ringing

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.64.1/a3d09c1b794f2f78720ef3f73daf147c8522cf6535fc2d8f3c35f0b41c36b801

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I’m not entirely sure why it could be but notifications are degrading for me. I either don’t receive, or others don’t receive. It was significantly better last year. Now I need to send two messages to Android users for them to process messages. I’ve had maybe a 75% success rate when sending messages compared to my previous 95%.

If I’d take a guess, more than a quarter of my messages aren’t being delivered either until a minute later or otherwise. My guess is that something has changed with FCM, cause it wasn’t this bad before. There was a point in time where it was nearly perfect.

Would throttling secuential FCM messages help? Like, if I’m sending 20 messages to a user, maybe only the first message of the burst send?

When selecting a chat, the options that appear overlap with the navigation bar. This does not happen when selecting messages inside a chat. Not sure if this bug appeared with this exact beta version.

Logs

Screenshot:

image1080×2340 127 KB
